t: Ah,*pn land of whirring wings that*ld is beyond the rivers of Cush,

which*ln sends ambassadors by the sea, in*ld vessels of papyrus on the waters! Go,*ln you swift messengers, to*ld a nation tall and smooth, to*ln a people feared near and far, a*ld nation mighty and conquering, whose*ld land the rivers divide.
All*pn you inhabitants of the world, you*ld who dwell on the earth, when*ln a signal is raised on the mountains, look! When*ld a trumpet is blown, hear!
For*ln thus the Lord*s said to me: “I*ln will quietly look from my dwelling like*ld clear heat in sunshine, like*ld a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”

For*ln before the harvest, when the blossom is over, and*ld the flower becomes a ripening grape, he*ln cuts off the shoots with pruning hooks, and*ld the spreading branches he lops off and clears away.

They*ln shall all of them be left to*ld the birds of prey of the mountains and*ld to the beasts of the earth. And*ln the birds of prey will summer on them, and*ld all the beasts of the earth will winter on them.

At*p that time tribute will be brought to the Lord*s of hosts from*pn a people tall and smooth, from*ld a people feared near and far, a*ln nation mighty and conquering, whose*ld land the rivers divide, to*p Mount Zion, the place of the name of the Lord*s of hosts.
